steps.title: Open the Minecraft Launcher.
steps.content: Open the Minecraft Launcher. You can use the Minecraft Launcher to load earlier versions of Minecraft. This method will work as long as you're using Minecraft 1.14.3 or later. If you're already playing a game in the Launcher, you'll need to quit it and restart the Launcher before you can switch versions. It's not possible to switch back to an older version of Minecraft using the Android or iPhone mobile app.

steps.title: Click Installations.
steps.content: Click Installations . It's the second tab at the top of the Launcher. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click + New.
steps.content: Click + New . It's near the top-center part of the Launcher. This opens the "Create new installation" window. [2] X Research source You will need to enable Historical Versions if you want to play an Alpha or Beta version of the game.

steps.title: Type a name for your installation into the "Name" field.
steps.content: Type a name for your installation into the "Name" field. For example, you could type the name of the server you'll be connecting to here.

steps.title: Select a version from the "Version" menu.
steps.content: Select a version from the "Version" menu. It's to the right of the "Name" field. For example, if you're connecting to a server that requires you to downgrade to version 1.13.2, you can select 1.13.2 from the menu. [3] X Research source If you'd like to customize the resolution of your new installation, enter the dimensions into the "Resolution" blanks.

steps.title: Select a directory from the "Game Directory" menu.
steps.content: Select a directory from the "Game Directory" menu. If you leave the default option ( Use default directory ) selected, Minecraft will store the old version's data in the default directory. However, if you want to play a version earlier than 1.6, you'll need to select a different folder. Click Browse to choose a directory.

steps.title: Click the Create button.
steps.content: Click the Create button. It's at the bottom-right corner of the window. This adds the older version to your list of installations. To play the older version of Minecraft, click Play at the top of the Launcher to return to the main screen, select the desired version from the drop-down menu at the bottom of the screen, and then click the large green Play button.
